Project 2: For Sale

Description

Design a responsive, three page site for a fictional retail company. You will create the company name and branding as well as curate a selection of goods the company sells prior to the design of the site. The site must have:

  • A home page – Introduces the company and the kinds of goods it sells and shows some of the inventory
  • A product page – Shows a specific item that has at least 2 different variations for the customer to select. Examples of variations could be color and size if it was clothing, material and color if it was furniture.
  • A third page that you decide on – Options could be a cart, rewards program, customer login page, about page, etc.). The content of this page will depend on the kind of page you select.
  • A footer – Each page should have a footer that provides relevant information about the company.
  • A navigation – Each page should have navigation to get you from one page to the next.

Requirements

  • At least 3 pages
  • Navigation
  • Mobile (320px) interactive prototype
  • Tablet (768px) designs
  • Desktop (1440px) interactive prototype
  • Brief style guide that includes fonts, colors, and any graphic elements or treatments

Checkpoints

  • February 25: Start
  • March 4: 3 proposed companies with potential products
  • March 11: Spring Break
  • March 18: 10 logo options, colors, fonts, images, items, and inspiration for brand
  • March 25: Style guide and wireframes for the home page at all sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop)
  • April 1: First draft of home page (all sizes), components and styles in Figma
  • April 8: Further refined home page (all sizes), first draft of product page (all sizes)
  • April 15: Further refined home and product pages (all sizes), first draft of third page (all sizes), full initial prototype if not complete
  • April 22: Refined prototype
  • April 29: Catch up week
  • May 6: Due
